preqs: FIT1031 or FIT1001 and FIT1008 or FIT1015

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {FIT1001, FIT1031} and  Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {FIT1008, FIT1015} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS})

description: This unit covers the internal mechanism of computers and how they are organised and programmed. Topics include combinatorial and sequential logic, Boolean Algebra, Karnaugh maps, counters, ripple adders, tree adders, memory/addressing, busses, speed, DMA, data representation, machine arithmetic, microprogramming, caches and cache architectures, virtual memory and translation look-aside buffers, vectored interrupts, polled interrupts, pipelined architecture, superscalar architecture, data dependency, hazards, CISC, RISC, VLIW machine architectures.
